alert.note: Alert for Abbeville; Anderson; Cherokee; Greenville; Laurens; Spartanburg; Union (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 03 at 7:07PM EST until March 03 at 7:45PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EST FOR NORTHWESTERN LAURENS...SOUTHEASTERN GREENVILLE...SOUTHERN SPARTANBURG...EAST CENTRAL ANDERSON...SOUTH CENTRAL CHEROKEE... NORTHEASTERN ABBEVILLE AND NORTHWESTERN UNION COUNTIES... At 707 PM EST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 14 miles southwest of Spartanburg to 12 miles east of Anderson, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. Locations impacted include... Laurens, Fountain Inn, Woodruff, Honea Path, Gray Court, Jonesville, Moore, Fork Shoals, Princeton and Pauline. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EST for Upstate South Carolina. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. A few trees and power lines will be blown down in the warned area. Storms will be accompanied by brief heavy rainfall, and little or no lightning. Seek shelter inside an interior room. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Abbeville; Anderson; Cherokee; Greenville; Laurens; Spartanburg; Union
